document.docAuthor: Li, Weichun, Li, Houhun & Nuss, Matthias
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the genus Eudonia Billberg, 1820 from China (Lepidoptera: Crambidae: Scopariinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the genus Eudonia Billberg, 1820 from China (Lepidoptera: Crambidae: Scopariinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to Chinese species of
Eudonia
based on female genitalia

subSubSection.paragraph:
(excluding
E. owadai
,
E. taiwanalpina
and
E. umbrosa
whose females are unknown)

paragraph.keyLead: 1 . Colliculum one third to half length of ductus bursae......................................................... 2
- Colliculum much less than one third length of ductus bursae................................................. 18
2 . Colliculum slightly shorter than half length of ductus bursae.................................................. 3
- Colliculum about one third length of ductus bursae......................................................... 5

4 . Ductus bursae with a median loop (
Fig. 29
).............................................
E. zhongdianensis
sp. n.

- Ductus bursae with two loops anteriorly (
Nuss 2005 : Fig. 81
).......................................
E. mercurella

7 . Anterior one third of ductus bursae with three folds (
Fig. 33
)...................................
E. duospinata
sp. n.

- Anterior one third of ductus bursae with one fold (
Sasaki 1998 : Fig. 42
).................................
E. albilinea

8 . Apophysis anterior as long as apophysis posterior (
Sasaki 1998 : Fig. 43
)................................
E. gigantea

- Apophysis anterior two thirds length of apophysis posterior (
Leraut 1986 :
Fig. 8
)..........................
E. tibetalis

- Ductus bursae with three loops (
Fig. 28
)...................................................
E. lijiangensis
sp. n.

11 . Signum placed in anterior part of corpus bursae (
Fig. 26
)......................................
E. rectilineata
sp. n.

12 . Ductus bursae looped at about middle (
Fig. 25
)..........................................
E. singulannulata
sp. n.

- Ductus bursae looped near corpus bursae (
Fig. 30
)................................................
E. furva
sp. n.

14 . Signum placed in posterior half of corpus bursae (
Fig. 27
)....................................
E. wolongensis
sp. n.

15 . Ostium bursae three times as wide as colliculum (
Fig. 32
).........................................
E. magna
sp. n.

- Ostium bursae twice as wide as colliculum (
Sasaki 1991 :
Fig. 28
).....................................
E. persimilis

- Ductus bursae not looped medially (
Sasaki 1999 :
Fig. 8
)............................................
E. promiscua

17 . Two loops at middle of ductus bursae (
Sasaki 1999 :
Fig. 7
)..........................................
E. apicifusca

- One loop at middle of ductus bursae, other loop at anterior part of ductus bursae (
Nuss 2005 : Fig. 107
).....
E. truncicolella

19 . Ductus bursae with two loops (
Nuss 2005 : Fig. 84
)................................................
E. lacustrata

20 . Corpus bursae medially with an ovate signum (
Fig. 34
)............................................
E. cavata
sp. n.

- Corpus bursae posteriorly with a stripelike signum (sasaki 1991 : fig. 29 )............................
E. microdontalis

keyStep.keyLead:
21 . Ductus bursae with five loops (
Sasaki 1991 :
Fig. 27
)................................................
E. puellaris Ductus
bursae with six loops (
Fig. 31
)......................................................
E. hexamera
sp. n.
